AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Carlos Martinez-Romero: Defendant, Appellant, and individual convicted of possession of marijuana, exhibited suspicious behavior during a traffic stop, argued against the trial court's decision to not suppress evidence, driver of a crew-cab truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.David Fitzgerald: Border Patrol Agent who conducted the investigatory stop, arrested the appellant, testified as a witness, observed appellant's suspicious activities, has experience with alien-smuggling vehicles and modifications that often serve illegal purposes, discovered marijuana in the toolbox of the truck, conducted the stop approximately sixty-eight miles from the border, provided testimony on the credibility of his experience with similar vehicle modifications, noticed appellant traveling at low speed and appearing tense, encountered a unique modification to the crew-cab's backseat, used a key attached to the ignition to open the toolbox
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Catherine Stone: Justice who authored the court opinion
